title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
vmassol - (00:09): lucaa: thomasM would know more since he's coded this  
vmassol - (00:09): I think it's by design but we haven't paid attention to the size and there are stuff that should not be included in the zip as you mentioned  
lucaa - (00:10): I was going to search that code too, but I drifted a bit  
vmassol - (00:10): 45MB for exporting a page to HTML is indeed quite a lot :)  
vmassol - (00:24): nn

bblfish - (00:30): good night!

bblfish - (08:52): good morning  
vmassol - (08:53): good morning  
bblfish - (08:54): vmassol: I think chromium is cheating a bit with memory useage. In fact one has to be careful and see all the threads it creates and calculate how much mem they take up. It seems to be 20MB per thread. Not sure how much is shared.  
bblfish - (08:55): so all in all I don't think it uses less memory that Opera. But it's nice  
vmassol - (08:57): ok  
bblfish - (08:58): is myxwiki fixed?  
vmassol - (08:58): no  
vmassol - (08:58): I've downgraded it to 2.2  
vmassol - (08:58): today we need to find out what the pb is  
vmassol - (08:58): and there are still pbs even now with 2.2  
bblfish - (08:59): oh dear, mhh. Sounds like a Database change  
vmassol - (09:00): there are 2 pbs I know  
vmassol - (09:00): - recent changes  
vmassol - (09:00): - my recent modifications panel  
vmassol - (09:00): probably the same problem  
vmassol - (09:00): CalebJamesDeLisl sent a mail, need to read it and find when we caused a regression  
vmassol - (09:00): it's not happening on my local 2.2 so it's probably related to  mysql  
vmassol - (09:01): (since my local install is hsqldb)  
bblfish - (09:01): ok, good luck. I'll try finishing my "RDF Semantics" paper...  
vmassol - (09:01): but I'm surprised we didn't got more reported problems with 2.2 so something is amiss  
vmassol - (09:01): s/got/get/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:05): Good morning, what was the last version on myxwiki before 2.2?  
vmassol - (09:05): you mean before we upgraded to 2.3 snap?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:05): Yes, that's what I meant.  
vmassol - (09:05): hmm must have been 2.0.2 I think  
vmassol - (09:05): maybe 2.1  
vmassol - (09:05): I don't know  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:06): Lot of changes in HibernateStore since 2.1  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:14): xwiki.org is running okay on 2.2.1.27354  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:15): Looks like maybe it's just mysql configuration.  
vmassol - (09:19): hmm  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:20  
vmassol - (09:21): first I'd like to understand why tehre are so many DB that fail to upgrade, mysql says they don't exist  
jvdrean - (09:21): Hi, RecentChanges is broken on 2.3 if running on mysql ?  
vmassol - (09:21): nantesjug, testtestN, etc, there are about 20 or 30 that fail at startup  
vmassol - (09:21): jvdrean: on 2.2 right now it's broken  
vmassol - (09:22): I've put back 2.2 yesterday  
vmassol - (09:22): when I couldn't restart 2.3  
vmassol - (09:22): moving to my office, bb in 1 minute  
vmassol left at 09:23 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:24  
vmassol - (09:24): back  
vmassol - (09:28): btw to prove my point of yesteray: http://twitter.com/2smart4u/statuses/9987813113  
vmassol - (09:38): jvdrean: what should people do when they have big buttons? (as on http://wikiparis.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/wiki/). Is there a way for us to avoid this pb?

vmassol - (09:40): yes but more specifically?  
vmassol - (09:40): any page?  
jvdrean - (09:40): I can't see the page but I assume it's the search panel  
vmassol - (09:40): yes  
jvdrean - (09:40): so the page in question is the search panel  
vmassol - (09:40): so the search panel page?  
vmassol - (09:40): we changed the image?  
jvdrean - (09:40): we changed ids to classes iirc  
vmassol - (09:41): ah it's this one  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:44  
vmassol - (09:48): another pb on myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (09:48): trying to delete a page fails  
vmassol - (09:49): http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/delete/XWiki/XWikiServerAsiri  
vmassol - (09:51): we need to get teh SQL query that executes  
vmassol - (09:53): on myxwiki.org: Server version: 5.0.51a-24+lenny2 (Debian)  
vmassol - (09:53): on xwiki.org: mysql  Ver 14.12 Distrib 5.0.51a, for debian-linux-gnu (x86\_64) using readline 5.2  
vmassol - (09:54): so same version it appeats  
vmassol - (09:54): appears  
vmassol - (09:54): config might be different though  
vmassol - (09:55): wait  
vmassol - (09:55): I logged twice on xwiki.org  
vmassol - (09:55): ;)  
vmassol - (09:55): myxwiki.org I mean  
vmassol - (09:56): on xwiki.org it's: mysql  Ver 14.12 Distrib 5.0.32, for pc-linux-gnu (i486) using readline 5.2  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:58  
vmassol - (09:59): their conf is slightly different: http://pastebin.com/rkfT2Fib  
vmassol - (10:00): xwiki.org is not utf8  
vmassol - (10:00): maxallowed packet bigger on xwiki.org  
vmassol - (10:01): but otherwise not much differences  
tmortagne - (10:04): [release] Finishing reading my mail and looking at hudson and will be ready to start the 2.2.2 release  
tmortagne - (10:04): is there anything needed before ?  
vmassol - (10:04): well if we find a pb on 2.2 on myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (10:05): it would be good to have the fix  
vmassol - (10:05): but we still don't know what the pb is  
vmassol - (10:06): I've just tried with a recent mysql  and 2.2 branch locally and I don't have the pb  
vmassol - (10:08): guysn wdyt about turning on logging on myxwiki.org to see the SQL calls that execute?  
jvdrean - (10:09): ssh: connect to host myxwiki.org port 22: Connection refused  
vmassol - (10:10): I4m in

jvdrean joined #xwiki at 10:16  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:17  
vmassol - (10:17): I think it's this one:  
vmassol - (10:17):  select distinct xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_WEB as col\_0\_0\_, xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_NAME as col\_1\_0\_, max(xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_DATE) as col\_2\_0\_ from xwikidoc xwikidocum0\_, xwikircs xwikircsno1\_ where (xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_HIDDEN<>1 or xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_HIDDEN is null) and xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_ID=xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_DOCID and xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_VERSION2=1 group by xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_WEB , xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_NAME order by max(xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_DATE) desc limit ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:18): Looks like the one.  
DV joined #xwiki at 10:18  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:19): I just started 2.1 and 2.2 connected to two mysql databases.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:19): I mean 2.1 and the 2.3 trunk  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:20): started 2.1 and tried to import the trunk xar.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:20): Incorrect string value: '\xC4\xAB t\xC4\xAB...' for column 'XWD\_CONTENT' at row 1  
vmassol - (10:20): yep  
arkub joined #xwiki at 10:20  
vmassol - (10:20): that's "normal"  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:20): ok  
vmassol - (10:20): sdumitriu: btw have you seen this: http://twitter.com/2smart4u/statuses/9987813113 ?  
vmassol - (10:20): your db is not utf8  
vmassol - (10:21): so 3 pages will fail to load  
vmassol - (10:21): (the translations)  
sdumitriu - (10:22): vmassol: seen it, replied to it  
vmassol - (10:22): me too  
vmassol - (10:22): found the pb  
vmassol - (10:22): on myxwiki.org:  
vmassol - (10:22): mysql>  select distinct xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_WEB as col\_0\_0\_, xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_NAME as col\_1\_0\_, max(xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_DATE) as col\_2\_0\_ from xwikidoc xwikidocum0\_, xwikircs xwikircsno1\_ where (xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_HIDDEN<>1 or xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_HIDDEN is null) and xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_ID=xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_DOCID and xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_VERSION2=1 group by xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_WEB , xwikidocum0\_.XWD\_NAME order by max(xwikircsno1\_.XWR\_DATE) desc;  
vmassol - (10:22): ERROR 1030 (HY000): Got error 28 from storage engine  
vmassol - (10:22): and just executed on xwiki.org and it works  
vmassol - (10:22): now we need to find what is this error  
vmassol - (10:22): googling....  
vmassol - (10:24): jvdrean: hmm /tmp is full but it's very small too  
vmassol - (10:24): is that normal?  
vmassol - (10:24): apparently this error means disk full  
vmassol - (10:24): http://www.spiration.co.uk/post/1337/MySQL%20-%20Re:%20ERROR%201030%20%28HY000%29:%20Got%20error%2028%20from%20storage%20engine  
vmassol - (10:25): indeed:  
vmassol - (10:25): tmpdir          = /tmp  
vmassol - (10:26): is set in my.cnf  
vmassol - (10:27): pb solved  
vmassol - (10:27): :)  
vmassol - (10:27): and this was the pb with 2.3 too  
vmassol - (10:27): pfew  
vmassol - (10:27): tmortagne: you can go ahead with the release I think  
vmassol - (10:27): ok so here's the story:  
vmassol - (10:28): when I couldn't start tomcat yesterday with the jars provided by henry, I moved them to /tmp tmeporarily  
vmassol - (10:28): I also used tmp to copy some log files so that I could look at them  
vmassol - (10:28): this filled /tmp  
vmassol - (10:28): and caused all the pbs I had to restart tomcat on 2.3  
vmassol - (10:28): and somehwoe it restarted better on 2.2  
vmassol - (10:29): but not fully since we had this query on error  
vmassol - (10:29): we have 16K of /tmp on myxwiki.org.....  
vmassol - (10:29): 16MB  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:30): Just started 2.3 trunk on mysql and imported default pages.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:30): no panels, looks like albatross skin...  
xipe - (10:30): that's normal, /tmp is a tmpfs (it's in ram not on disk) to speed up performances  
vmassol - (10:30): so now I'm going to stop myxwiki.org agaion  
vmassol - (10:30): and move back to 2.3 snap  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:30): I'll keep looking for (my) mistakes.  
xipe - (10:30): but if you need to move big files, you should use /var/tmp/  
vmassol - (10:30): xipe: ok thanks, my bad then  
vmassol - (10:31): (didn't know)  
vmassol - (10:31): first let me clean up dead descriptors

sdumitriu - (10:48): So +1 for pg

vmassol - (11:05): the db is still there

vmassol - (11:28): • http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs

vmassol - (11:33): I don't think we have a choice do we?

jvdrean - (11:34): if some 2.2 pages are broken with a 2.3 war

vmassol - (11:35): (step 17)  
jvdrean - (11:36): I stopped at 12) yes  
mflorea1 left at 11:37 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (11:38): btw I don't like the import UI  
vmassol - (11:38): it's not convenient  
vmassol - (11:38): it should be a livetable instead  
vmassol - (11:38): so that you can easily find pages  
vmassol - (11:38): and check/uncheck them  
vmassol - (11:39): a livetable like with folding support  
tmortagne - (11:40): vmassol: it's better than before ;)  
vmassol - (11:40): yes  
vmassol - (11:40): well  
vmassol - (11:40): not true  
vmassol - (11:40): it's worse for selecting pages you want to exclude  
jvdrean - (11:40): I disagree  
jvdrean - (11:40): (after upgrading 10 xwiki.org wikis)  
tmortagne - (11:40): well you just have to click on the folder  
vmassol - (11:41): you have to manually open each tab individually  
tmortagne - (11:41): given all the pros i think it's ok  
vmassol - (11:41): so that you have files listed  
jvdrean - (11:41): space ordering + alpha ordering is a huge improvement  
sdumitriu - (11:41): vmassol: How can it be worse than before?  
sdumitriu - (11:41): It used to be an unordered list of names  
vmassol - (11:41): I didn't say it's worse  
sdumitriu - (11:41): (11:40:21 AM) vmassol: it's worse for selecting pages you want to exclude  
vmassol - (11:41): I said it's worse for selecting pages you want to exclude  
vmassol - (11:41): overall it's much better  
tmortagne - (11:42): it's worstif you use the search to find the exact page to unselect  
vmassol - (11:42): yes  
tmortagne - (11:42): but it's way better when you review the pages  
tmortagne - (11:42): one by one  
vmassol - (11:42): well you never do that  
vmassol - (11:42): :)  
vmassol - (11:42): you just know which ones to excvlude  
jvdrean - (11:43): we could add an 'expand all' button  
tmortagne - (11:43): we never do that with a standard XE  
tmortagne - (11:43): but this UI is about import in general not only XE  
vmassol - (11:43): jvdrean: I think a better improvement would be to add live search  
jvdrean - (11:44): meta+F is my live search  
vmassol - (11:44): if you think it's good like this I'm going to let you do the upgrade :)  
vmassol - (11:44): because it's really painful  
jvdrean - (11:45): I haven't said upgrades are not painful, I do know what it's like to do one ^^  
vmassol - (11:45): hmm why do we exclude the blog space?  
vmassol - (11:45): (the whole space)  
vmassol - (11:45): there might have beenc hanges  
vmassol - (11:45): oh  
vmassol - (11:45): my bad  
vmassol - (11:46): we don't use teh blog  
vmassol - (11:46): :)  
vmassol - (11:46): (on the main wiki)  
vmassol - (11:46): on the positivie side: excluding a space is working well  
vmassol - (11:47): wild idea: allow to import a preconfigured list of files to exclude… or have the notion of sets  
vmassol - (11:49): jvdrean/tmortagne: I'm going to add to the history (I think it's the safest to useà, ok?  
tmortagne - (11:49): +1  
jvdrean - (11:50): +1  
tmortagne - (11:50): it's a good use case to test this feature anyway and since it's supposed to be the default and safest we should validate it as much as we can  
vmassol - (11:51): we're missing versoin 1.1  
vmassol - (11:51): for ex: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs?viewer=history&showminor=true  
tmortagne - (11:52): you mean for old docs ?  
vmassol - (11:52): seems to be everywhere: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?viewer=history&showminor=true  
tmortagne - (11:52): or the one you just imported ?$  
vmassol - (11:52): I imported over

sdumitriu - (19:25): vmassol: Can you explain what you mean by this:  
sdumitriu - (19:25): \* modify the XWikiDocument's javadoc to deprecate setDocumentReference and all setXXX that change the reference since XWikiDocument should be immutable re its reference (the storage impl today doesn't support a XWikiDocument that has its reference that is modified).  
vmassol - (19:27): actually it's thomas who explained this to me  
vmassol - (19:27): does it work?  
vmassol - (19:27): (if you change a doc's reference)  
vmassol - (19:27): what happens to the doc cache?  
sdumitriu - (19:28): Borked  
vmassol - (19:28): so that's why  
sdumitriu - (19:28): But I mean explain differently  
sdumitriu - (19:28): Not why, but what  
vmassol - (19:28): the idea is that XWikiDocumet takes the ref in its consturctor  
vmassol - (19:29): and that once a XWikiDoc has been created it hsould change its ref  
vmassol - (19:29): shouldn't  
vmassol - (19:29): (not should)  
vmassol - (19:29): if you need a new ref then you need to construct a new doc or copy the current doc, or rename it, etc  
sdumitriu - (19:29): OK, I see  
vmassol - (19:30): this is not really related to my change  
vmassol - (19:30): it's just the realization that changing the ref isn't probably working right now
